body_html:
@jvdillon Given that this issue #5802 is still open, is there any way currently to run anything in the bayesflow module with:

  1. The log-joint has more than one variable (currently it seems that leapfrog_step assumes that the inputs cannot be a list)
  2. Don't have access to a function mapping x -> log p(x), but rather we have x and the graph node representing log p(x)? E.g. are there any workarounds for constructing a function from the graph? If so where can I find examples?

Atm given that I just found out about these it's making my life hell, as we want to test HMC on a small network...

The log-joint has more than one variable (currently it seems that leapfrog_step assumes that the inputs cannot be a list)
Don't have access to a function mapping x -> log p(x), but rather we have x and the graph node representing log p(x)? E.g. are there any workarounds for constructing a function from the graph? If so where can I find examples?

Atm given that I just found out about these it's making my life hell, as we want to test HMC on a small network...
body:
@jvdillon  Given that this issue #5802 is still open, is there any way currently to run anything in the bayesflow module with:

1. The log-joint has more than one variable (currently it seems that `leapfrog_step` assumes that the inputs cannot be a list)
2. Don't have access to a function mapping x -> log p(x), but rather we have x and the graph node representing log p(x)? E.g. are there any workarounds for constructing a function from the graph? If so where can I find examples?

Atm given that I just found out about these it's making my life hell, as we want to test HMC on a small network...
